overview: With the work of all, we build a capable, caring, and inspired community. As a school community, we provide an academic program that prepares our scholars for college and career readiness. We inspire our scholars to become productive members of our global society that are able to compete in an increasingly complex world in which they will work and live. The caring and dedicated staff at West Prep will continue to encourage all students to set high goals for themselves and to reach for their dreams. At West Prep we empower our scholars to be "TITAN STRONG". Through our community partnerships, our scholars learn about themselves not only academically, but also physically, socially, and emotionally. Our mission is to provide our students with a foundation for success as they matriculate through West Prep, and meet their full potential in life.

overview: Cypress Hills Community School (CHCS) is a small, community-based, dual-language school where students learn in Spanish and English. The school's mission is for all students to become fully bilingual and bi-cultural, and to be deeply concerned about themselves and each other, their community, and the world. We offer native language instruction to all students, including: Spanish language arts, content area instruction in Spanish, and targeted tutoring groups during the school day and after school. The small environment allows students to develop positive relationships with their teachers, where they benefit from both academic and emotional support. CHCS has developed a philosophy guided by Project CARE (Communication, Accountability, Respect, and Effort). These core values provide a common language we believe is necessary for fostering and maintaining a peaceful and productive environment.

overview: Welcome to I.S. 171, Home of the Lincoln Scholar. We at Abraham Lincoln Intermediate School 171 are a community of educators dedicated to the belief that every child can learn and is entitled to a high-quality education. Our students have the opportunity to take the Algebra and US History Regents Exams as well the Spanish Language Proficiency Exam. We were the first in the city to host the Middle School Student Success Center (MSSSC), which focuses on supporting students' high school and college choice and preparation. Students can choose from Visual Arts, Debate, Theater arts, Spanish class and Coding class. We offer the following after-school programs: Theater/Drama, Video Game Truck, Modeling & Etiquette, and Debate Team. Students can also participate in Student Government, Project BOOST, STEM Club, Student Dances, College Prep assemblies, and MSSSC year-long activities. We also host Family Honor Roll Dinners, Student of the Month assemblies, Family Movie Nights, Staff vs. Student Basketball Games, and our annual Community Carnival.

We also host Family Honor Roll Dinners, Student of the Month assemblies, Family Movie Nights, Staff vs. Student Basketball Games, and our annual Community Carnival.

printedschoolname: James P. Sinnott Magnet School for Health and Health Careers
overview: James P. Sinnott is a 21st Century Community School. We have a magnet program focused on health and health professions. There is also a wellness committee which focuses on a month-by-month health theme that is ingrained in the culture of the school. We offer students an Honors program with Regents courses, Spanish Dual Language Cohort, and a Dance Cohort. We also have the only Day NYPD/FDNY Explorer Program with the Learning for Life advisory curriculum. Parents are always invited to our school to help build culture and to celebrate our students. We provide our students with a stable, secure, and structured learning environment and the highest quality classroom instruction. A wide variety of support and intervention services are also offered. We strive to achieve academic excellence.

overview: The mission of J.H.S. 292 is to create a secure environment that embraces each student's individual talents and maximizes his or her potential. Our programs assist in preparing students for higher education while developing their sense of responsibility and building self-esteem. In our quest to produce successful young adults, we have created an open-door policy where teachers, parents, and students work side by side on academics and life experiences to further the growth of students. This is done by the implementation and sustenance of mentoring groups and Student Council, all of which focus on fostering leadership potential, community service, and helping students gain the world view that they need. Parents are impressed by the fact that we offer a performing arts component where each child has the opportunity to participate in an elective that will complement their academics, making them well-rounded citizens.

overview: Our FALCONS enjoy the personalized attention which they receive in our small, nurturing learning academies. Our small academies afford us the opportunity to provide an encouraging environment, where students are able to create lasting relationships with the staff. We strive to cultivate a dynamic environment of advanced thinkers, high achievers, and model citizens. The staff works to develop an educational program based on the unique needs of each student. In collaboration with parents, we support the intellectual, emotional, and social growth of students. We strive for academic excellence by maintaining high expectations. We believe that every child can and will succeed academically and will be able to develop a strong personal sense of discipline and social responsibility. Gateway FALCONS are provided with a rich academic curriculum which is enhanced through the use of SMART Boards and mobile computer labs and differentiated based on student need. Our open-door policy ensures that parents will have full accessibility and are able to continuously check their child's progress through the use of our computer grading system. Gateway FALCONS have been accepted into TEAK, Prep for Prep, and A Better Chance programs.

overview: Academy for Young Writers is a supportive, 6-12 community school focused on college and career readiness. We are located in a new building, equipped with state-of-the-art technology. In addition to rigorous core classes, students take courses in musical theater, dance, computer science, coding, drumline, health, art, and band. Writing courses craft original works of writing that are published in grade-wide collections. Middle school students take coding classes to prepare for our extensive computer science and robotics program in the high school. All students also attend monthly field trips, overnight nature trips, and numerous college trips. We offer a variety of after-school activities, such as Tai Chi, Broadway jr, boxing, gaming, glee, basketball, football, LGBTQ club, GSA, robotics & honor society. We practice restorative justice. We build community and student voice in small advisory groups to allow students and staff to develop relationships. The advisor is the primary point-of-contact for parents. Parents can view their student's grades online. We have an active Parent Teacher Association (PTA). Parents appreciate the ease to which they can communicate with teachers, advisors, and administration about students' progress.

We are a small school and offer classes of approximately 25 students which allows our students to develop academically and socially. Our teaching staff is extremely caring and focused, and students have multiple opportunities to work through their academic challenges with effective guidance and support. Our staff is very accessible and professional. We are particularly encouraging and open to families, as evident in the number of siblings who attend both the middle and high school sections. We have a full-size pool, state-of-the-art computer room, and a new media center.

overview: At Spring Creek Community School (SCCS), a grade 6-12 school opened in 2012, students engage in project-based curriculum that emphasizes critical thinking, questioning, and problem-solving. Arts and technology are integrated into daily instruction, and students are programmed for additional math and literacy periods to support their success across the curriculum. Students benefit from enrichment electives and school-based partnerships with arts and academic organizations. All classrooms are equipped with SMART Boards, document cameras, and multiple computers. Students are in an advisory that provides each child with social, emotional, and academic supports. Advisors support students throughout middle school, and build long-term relationships with families. Parents appreciate our focus on collaboration and communication, and all parents are registered with an online account, which gives them access to student progress reports and allows them to contact teachers directly. In order to support our six through twelve model, students who attend SCCS in middle school are strongly encouraged to continue their education in our high school.

overview: Van Siclen Community Middle School is a safe space for students to strengthen their academic and social abilities through rigorous instruction in the core curriculum while teaching them how to work collaboratively. In our dynamic classrooms, students generate solutions to address real-world issues, utilizing technology infused throughout the program to facilitate development of their 21st Century skills. Students participate in individualized mentorships with school personnel to foster interpersonal skills and develop college- and career-readiness. Dedicated educators and mentors, who are devoted to each child's academic and emotional growth, support students in every subject area and encourage integration across subject areas. Subjects are taught thematically, focusing on issues that are currently facing our society.

overview: At Vista Academy, students enjoy the safe learning environment and great conversation about their learning with classmates and adults. The Decision Making Period (DMP) is at the heart of Vista Academy's character education curriculum. Students appreciate the real-life scenarios encountered in this course and find the information relevant to their lives both in and out of school. Students feel supported by the adults in the community and are comfortable having personal and academic conversations about their lives and future in both English and Spanish. Vista Academy is a small community school that provides strong academic instruction while placing a direct emphasis on values like respect, responsibility, and perseverance. Parents appreciate the school's focus on high academic achievement while developing their child's social and emotional character through the DMP. Parents value the nurturing environment that supports students academically and socially.

Students can choose from a variety of after-school activities to spark their interest and make them excited to come to school. Students like that their teachers find out about students' interests and use them to plan their lessons. For example, teachers might use sports to help teach math and forensics in science. Parents appreciate our school's focus on college and career success. With our small class sizes, and readily available teachers, we give individual attention to our students in order to build their character and academic ability. Parents like our commitment to keeping them informed about their child's progress through our online grading system. We integrate technology into school life as much as possible in order to enhance our instruction.

overview: School of the Future Brooklyn provides a dynamic learning environment where students love the ability to work as real writers, readers, historians, scientists, and mathematicians. We are a small learning community where all students are challenged in many ways and valued as individuals with various talents and expertise, which allows our students to develop academically and socially. Classes involve small group and individual assignments, as well as interactive projects. Throughout their middle school journey, students are encouraged to develop their own voices in academics through participation in school activities and advisory. One-on-one coaching gives students the chance to develop learning plans and work through their academic challenges with effective guidance and support. Parents love the one-on-one attention that each student receives in his/her academic coaching sessions. In addition, Our free after-school enrichment program offers something for everyone with step, music, dance, sports, and cooking, and so much more. Parents also love that we develop independent and resilient thinkers who are prepared for the demands of high school and beyond. We partner with our sister school, The School of the Future in Manhattan.

printedschoolname: East New York Middle School of Excellence
overview: Our scholars enjoy the individual attention they receive at East New York Middle School of Excellence (ENYMSE). At ENYMSE, our motto is "Success Without Excuses," and our scholars are held to that expectation every day. Scholars are able to pursue their education in a nurturing environment. Our school just completed construction of a state-of-the-art science lab. Scholars experience STEM units in both math and science courses. We enrich these programs through strategic partnerships and trips for our scholars. All of our scholars are involved in an array of clubs and teams allowing them to explore pursuits outside of their academic interest. Our after-school program enriches their experience through academics, sports, and the arts. Parents like the small school experience where each student has a STAR coach (advisor). We are committed to a strong parent-school partnership. We invite you to join our school community and find out why ENYMSE is Brooklyn's best-kept secret.

overview: The mission of Highland Park Community School (HPCS) is to cultivate empowered leaders and bold thinkers that create innovative solutions to problems locally and globally. Each grade has a real-world, project-based theme through which all instruction is connected. Students like these projects because they provide opportunities to tackle important social issues, make a difference in their community, be creative, and have fun while they apply new skills. Our scholars benefit from rigorous, exploratory instruction that prepares them for the best high schools and provides the foundation needed for college and career. Our advisory program supports students' social and emotional needs, and guides them as they develop and act on Individual Goal Plans (IGPs) focused on academic and personal goals. We encourage parent involvement that goes beyond attending PTA meetings-family members are encouraged to join us on field trips, volunteer, participate in projects, and support our initiatives.

overview: M.S. 907 opened its doors in Fall 2018. Imagine a place where your child’s creativity is tapped, their intellect is nurtured, their artistic talents are sharpened, and they are supported and happy. Welcome to M.S. 907 - a place for students to discover who they were meant to be! Our school combines standards-based academic instruction, exposure to the arts, and a projects-based approach to educate our students. And for those who exhibit exceptional academic or artistic aptitude, our Gifted and Talented program will challenge them so they can excel. Our model relies on student choice and exposure. Each semester sixth and seventh grade students will choose an arts elective (music, visual arts, creative writing, theater, and dance) to explore their skillsets. In their eighth grade year, students may narrow their focus to one specific arts connection to supplement their academics as they prepare for high school, college, and professional careers. Daily academic experiences will also be enriched for all students by authentic curricular connections to the arts. Picture it! As part of their creative arts or music elective, your child can learn to write poetry or songs to show the experiences of those they learn about in their humanities classes. Or, during dance elective, they can choreograph a jazz piece using their newfound math knowledge. As students grow at M.S. 907, they will build positive and enduring relationships with each other and the adults around them and develop their sense of self. They will also practice critical life skills such as persistence, flexible thinking, and innovation, habits of mind which will prepare them to be productive citizens in a 21st century global community. Every day our students will live our motto: Curiosity and creativity spark self-discovery!

overview: Students at Shell Bank enjoy getting to know their teachers in small group settings. Our programming allows teachers, administrators, and guidance counselors to get to know students on an individual basis. Shell Bank maintains unique programs that focus on college-and career-readiness, including an ongoing collaborative support system with parents. We offer a selection of courses that incorporate project based learning and student interest. Students can qualify for our elite SOAR program, which is based on Harvard University's Project Zero-this develops critical thinking, insight, and analysis capabilities. Each student in SOAR will be provided with a Chrome Book to help them experience media literacy and explore cross disciplinary thinking. Shell Bank students are educated through Google Classroom which allows parents to access student learning experiences and facilitates interactions between students, staff and home. Our school has a partnership with North Shore Animal League- students work with shelter and therapy dogs through our exclusive Muttigree and Comfort Dog programs. Our school also has the only ACES middle school program in District 22, which is staffed by teachers with special training and experience in this area.

overview: At Roy H. Mann, The School for Architectural Design and Innovative Technology, our mission is to provide all students with engaging, rigorous, and technology-based learning opportunities which align with the Common Core Learning Standards. All classrooms are air-conditioned and feature a 65-inch LED flat panel SMARTboard. Our students enjoy personalized attention from our dedicated grade teams. Every student has access to a full-time academic counselor, a vibrant and diverse arts program, and meaningful afterschool activities. Teachers utilize online academic enrichment programs (Achieve3000 & I-Ready Math), to collect data that informs instruction, which leads to improved ELA and math skills. Through our Schoolwide Enrichment Model (SEM), students develop skills, foster positive relationships, and experience social growth. Our enrichment clusters, and our embedded organizational skills program, promote creativity and collaboration, as well as support college and career readiness and community service. In partnership with staff, families and the community, we foster the emotional, social and intellectual growth of our students to prepare them to reach their full academic potential and become outstanding citizens.

Parents appreciate our small educational community, our emphasis on science and technology, and our desire to equip each and every student with the necessary tools to become leaders of tomorrow. We are part of the iLearnNYC program. iLearnNYC schools are implementing online and blended learning to expand current school boundaries that limit how and when a student can learn. iLearnNYC empowers teachers, administrators, students, and parents with cutting-edge resources, including online content, real-time data on student work, and many more educational tools.

overview: P.S./I.S. 206 is a multi-cultural school with approximately 1,500 students, 400 of which are in our middle school. Students have the opportunity for engaging discussions centered on critical thinking. Staff and administrators know students by their names and support their individual needs. Parents often want their child to attend our school because they feel confident that their child is in a safe and highly rigorous school. Students enjoy a healthy balance of strong academic instruction along with opportunities to develop their strengths in technology and the arts. Community service is a staple of our school and students enjoy the rewards of helping others. One of the most coveted positions is that of a student mentor where middle school students are able to support elementary students both academically and socially. SMART Boards, digital projectors, iPads, personal Androids, and over 200 new wireless laptops ensure that our students are ready for the technology-driven future. We also have an Arts program that includes Visual Arts, Sculpture, Band, Drama and Dance. Students have individualized programming and have the opportunity to make choices in their schedule as they prepare for high school.

overview: We have a diversity of special programs including many after-school activities. Through our after-school program our students have the option to participate in 2 drama performances. Fillmore Academy has a band and chorus program where middle school students and elementary school students perform together. Next year we will also have 3 new mobile science labs next year. One will be a STEM Lab and the other 2 will compliment our science curriculum in 7th and 8th grade. Through our big brother and big sister program middle school students mentor our 2nd and 3rd graders. Based on academic performance 8th grade students have the opportunity to take the Common Core Algebra Regents and/or Living Environment. Additionally an advanced art class is offered from 6-8th grade in order to prepare portfolios for art auditions for high school high schools. An enrichment program is offered to the middle school where students are exposed to animation, yoga, coding, bucket drumming, journalism, and NY Road Runners. Students and parents appreciate our academically-challenging curriculum and small middle school setting.

overview: We believe that a well-rounded individual, passionate about learning and committed to his or her talents, is best prepared for the demands of the modern career landscape. Through the approach of the Schoolwide Enrichment Model, the staff of M.S. 890 is committed to creating an engaging, supportive, and rigorous learning environment for everyone. Students choose an enrichment cohort and work side-by-side with their peers to dive deeply into their selected content area. Through guest speakers, field trips, and authentic learning tasks, students become experts in their selected field and work towards a culminating capstone project in senior year, during which they solve a self-identified problem or question and present their findings to the community. As a result, students grow as independent thinkers and apply what they learn to devise solutions that have a positive impact on their world. In addition, we offer opportunities for students to pursue their interests in sports, music, drama, clubs, foreign language, and writing both during and after school. Parents have a voice in school-based decisions via the School Leadership Team, Parent Association, fundraising, and our varied parent engagement events.

overview: Cunningham is a family-oriented, safe, and nurturing school whose students come from more than 30 different countries. In an effort to prepare our student body for college and career, we empower them to think critically and engage in rich peer-to-peer collaboration across all disciplines. Cunningham focuses on science, engineering, technology, math, the Arts, sustainability, and environmental issues through hands-on STEAM related activities, robotics, coding, Ever-fi, residencies, field trips, partnerships, Live Theater Program and service-learning opportunities. Students will become communicators and collaborators while learning new and exciting engineering and technology skills, conducting research, applying math concepts, enjoying the performing Arts and striving to create a model for a sustainable community. The program heightens students' curiosity in STEAM subjects by laying a solid foundation for futures in science, engineering, math, the performing Arts and tech fields through all subject areas by teaching the critical skills that life and work demand.

overview: Andries Hudde, I.S. 240 STEM Magnet School, promotes choice, equity, diversity, and excellence for all students. Students have full access to cutting edge, state of the art technology, preparing them for 21st century STEM based careers. Our students make real world connections through instruction. We create, collaborate, character build, and foster good self-esteem. We educate the whole child. We believe our instruction builds community, perks student curiosity, and bridges gaps. Our mission is to empower our students by providing solid academic skills, supporting them with resources that will make for dynamic future leaders and entrepreneurs. Our goal is to maximize student growth by providing them with a well-rounded, interdisciplinary education through project-based learning. Students will experience hands-on innovation, making for critical and creative thinkers. Students love to be at Hudde because of the many after-school and Saturday activities. We are rigorous, safe, and nurturing. We value the uniqueness of each student, preparing them for academic, artistic, musical, physical, and social/emotional growth. Hudde is more than a school, we are a family that is "Magnificent in Midwood".

overview: Marine Park J.H.S., located within the beautiful surroundings of Marine Park, provides a nurturing school environment where students develop college- and career-readiness through high level academics, various arts programs, and technology. Tech is infused into all of our classrooms through the use of SMART Boards, laptops, iPads, and e-readers. Students research skills on building and design which they explore through our award-winning STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) programs. Students also discover their talents through our arts programs. Marine Park embraces the comfort of our students in a fully air-conditioned building including all classrooms, the gymnasium, the cafeteria, and the auditorium. Parents and teachers enjoy a close relationship. There are multiple opportunities for correspondence including emails, PupilPath, School Messenger, phone calls, SLT, PA meetings, and parent workshops.

overview: I.S. 381 offers an intimate and nurturing environment for students where rigor and excellence is valued. Our staff works collaboratively to develop enriched, individualized curricula designed to meet the learning and social developmental needs of students. We offer both accelerated and school wide enrichment courses that promote students' interests and abilities. Accelerated course offerings include regents courses in Common Core Algebra I, Living Environment, and American History. Enrichment clusters include: photography, drama, movie making, visual art, LEGO robotics, dance, game design, computer coding, track and field, and blogging. All students participate in foreign language and visual arts classes. The school also offers Specialized High Schools Test preparation, and is a recipient of the SHSAT Pilot Program. This pilot program will provide students with the opportunity to participate in a complimentary after-school test prep course, as well as allow students to sit for the SHSAT examination at our school site, during the school day. Additionally, the school has a partnership with a community-based organization, Sports and Arts in School Foundations, that offers free after-school programs to all students.

printedschoolname: The Robert F. Wagner Jr. School (P.S./I.S. 78)
overview: We focus on providing our students with a challenging and global education while meeting the emotional, creative, and social needs of all students. We focus on critical thinking and problem solving through interactive literacy and math activities, enhanced through an integration of the arts into the core curriculum. Parents are actively involved in their children's education and we share the joys of watching our children grow, learn new skills, and make friends. We implement the Renzulli Schoolwide Enrichment Model (SEM) in all grades and include parent talent, community volunteers, and experts from the community in developing an enrichment curriculum. By addressing the needs of all students, including our students with special needs, English Language Learners, and gifted students, the SEM Model engages all of the children in visual, musical, spatial, and kinesthetic activities through their interests and talents thereby enabling them to enhance their academic potential.

overview: Community School 111Q has achieved success on the path to demonstrable improvement. A forerunner in Renewal efforts, we are implementing cutting edge educational programs that are supporting our scholars, parents, teachers, staff members, and the community. Our scholars engage in discussions with their peers and staff as they study academic and social theories and writing in all of the core subjects. We have implemented the Teacher's College Writing Curriculum, evaluative portfolios in core subject areas, the use of daily formative assessments to monitor progress, independent reading, myON, and Mathletics computer-based interventions and a balanced approach to literacy, science, social studies, and math instruction.

overview: Our Academy for the Intellectually Gifted at P.S. 122 is a district-wide Gifted and Talented program with a rich history. Our program design aims to maximize the degree of academic acceleration while providing a diverse array of enrichment opportunities and an emphasis on the physical, social, and emotional well-being of the exceptional students who are admitted to our school. We are committed to the goal of creating lifelong learners by providing a stimulating academic environment centered on students' interests. Academic content work incorporates many opportunities to engage in problem-based learning (PBL), challenging and creative projects, and teacher assessments, as well as self or peer assessments. Students are well prepared for academic requirements of New York City's specialized high schools. At "The Academy," we welcome the constructive participation of all stakeholders. We recognize that vibrant home/school/community partnerships increase the chances of maximizing our students' potential.

overview: I.S. 126 is committed to providing a safe learning environment where all students are held accountable to reach high levels of academic achievement. We challenge our students with a rigorous curriculum and college-readiness expectations. In addition to Regents classes, we offer preparatory classes for the Specialized High School Admissions Test (SHSAT) and the NYS State exams. I.S. 126 has a partnership with City Year, who assist our students in developing their academic and leadership skills. We enrich our students through arts residencies with our partners. We have a science lab and computer labs that are state-of-the-art. These programs allow us to extend the academic rigor in the classrooms. I.S. 126 believes parents are equal partners in their children's education. We foster an open-door policy, where parents are encouraged to communicate and build successful relationships with school leaders. We offer bus service for eligible sixth graders. We also have arts residencies with Community Word Project and Alvin Ailey.

Our shared vision is to inspire students to pursue their dreams by fostering a safe, trusting, and nurturing environment that will promote academic, social, and emotional growth of all scholars at P.S./I.S. 127Q. Our school offers three different program choices for English Language Learners (ELL). We have a K-8 dual language program. Students entering the dual language program in the 6th grade are given a baseline assessment in order for our school to provide the best services to ELLs.

overview: Nestled in the heart of Astoria, I.S. 141, which ranks top 20% for the past 10 years, provides rigorous academic instruction in a caring and supportive learning environment. Our focus is to challenge our students to excel in their academics, to foster critical thinking and intellectual curiosity, and to ensure that our students acquire the skills necessary to excel in high school, college, and beyond. A "Respect for All" school, 141 offers a strong Honors program, which provides in-depth study and prepares students for Regents exams in Living Environment and Algebra I, while also promoting the arts and humanities, by offering dance, music, and two art courses. This year, 30 students were accepted into NYC's Specialized High Schools and 34 were accepted into Townsend Harris, Bard, Frank Sinatra, Beacon, Baccalaureate, Manhattan/Hunter Science High School, High School of Fashion Industries, and Talent Unlimited. Our parent coordinator offers biweekly parent workshops addressing such topics as transitioning to middle school, high school admission process, SHSAT, and adolescent development of middle school students. Most importantly, IS 141 fosters an open door policy for all parents and guardians.

overview: The Louis Armstrong Middle School (LAMS), opened in 1979 with the mission of bringing together a group of culturally diverse children to help them grow academically, emotionally, physically, and socially. At LAMS, students are provided a personalized, caring, and supportive environment. The staff works to build the childrens' confidence and work ethic in order to develop a sense of pride in their choices, actions, and quality of work. In addition to the core subjects, LAMS offers Accelerated Regents courses, foreign language courses, music courses, art courses, physical and adaptive fitness courses, and technology courses. The school is affiliated with Queens College, Vaughn College, National Middle School Association, and National School Reform Policy. Our school is an original recipient of the U.S. President Award for Excellence, has been recognized four consecutive years as a Reward Status School, and by the NASSP as being, "one of the top 100 most effective middle schools in the U.S." Students receive stop to stop busing from any area in Queens.

overview: Intermediate School 230, The School for Civics in the Community, provides activities that engage, challenge, and stimulate students. Parents appreciate that we are a nurturing school, and as a result we are a very popular school. Our sixth-grade academy is housed in our annex which is located directly across the street from the main building. The main building houses our seventh and eighth grades. The small learning community of the annex provides a very important transition for students entering middle school. Intermediate School 230Q has developed a positive reputation based upon our challenging academic curricula, supportive teachers, and safe environment. Each year, a very limited number of seats are available for students residing outside of our geographical zone in Jackson Heights.

overview: The Academy for New Americans offers newly arrived immigrant students and their families the opportunity to adjust successfully to their new setting. The program offers a specialized curriculum that facilitates the acquisition of the English language through a one-year programmatic option. Our school is committed to providing the following services to our students: a welcoming climate that is conducive to English language acquisition, a specialized curriculum that focuses on English language proficiency, an environment that promotes self-esteem and addresses the needs of early adolescence, an introduction to the New York City school system, an emphasis on becoming familiar with American culture, computer literacy classes, support services such as counseling and tutoring, and a committed, well-trained staff that guides the students through the transition period as they become acclimated to our multicultural society.

overview: The Young Women's Leadership Schools (TYWLS) were established to nurture the intellectual curiosity and creativity of young women by supporting the whole girl in order to maximize academic achievement, social emotional well-being, and post-secondary success. TYWLS of Astoria is supported by The Young Women's Leadership Network (YWLN) and its College Bound Initiative in order to replicate the best practices of private and independent girls' schools. The school approaches learning in a dynamic, participatory fashion, encouraging students to take responsibility for their own learning. The school uses technology in nearly every class and every day to create a meaningful, cutting edge 21st century learning environment. Students are provided with rigorous STEM, humanities, and arts opportunities as they prepare for college and becoming future leaders. TYWLS of Astoria is an Apple Distinguished School for Technology.

overview: Students like our enthusiastic teachers who make learning interesting by bringing hands-on activities, field trips, and projects to our units of study. Students collaborate with a diverse group of peers through our supportive and challenging classrooms, advisory program, and school/PTA-run dances and other celebrations. Our in and after-school enrichments include 90 seats in a free five-day-a-week program run at our school by 82nd St Academics, award winning debate and chess clubs, sports teams, a coding partnership with Cornell Tech, and an amazing theater program. Parents value our high standards in all classes including Algebra for All and Science Regents for every eighth grader as well as our intervention and extension groupings for reading, writing, and math. Our online grading program allows families to stay updated every week on their child's academic and character progress. Our new shared building is located along the East River as part of the Hunter's Point South development area and contains a beautiful auditorium, music room, art room, and science labs. We are a fully inclusive school, meeting the needs of both gifted and talented students and students with learning or physical disabilities.

overview: Q300 is one of several NYC citywide gifted and talented schools. We are committed to a high-quality education that strives to cultivate a genuine love for learning in all of our students. Our approach is driven by the national standards of gifted education with the full understanding that we are stewards of our students' cognitive and affective growth. As a result of our strong collaboration with parents and external organizations we are able to offer our students: music, LEGO robotics, dance, debate, second language(s), architecture, and chess, Brain Games, Math Team, Spelling Bee and so much more. Our efforts to shape the whole child scaffold an exposure to rich information and knowledge, critical-thinking skills, and effective and relevant modes of communication.

overview: The Baccalaureate School for Global Education (BSGE) is a public school dedicated to the achievement of academic excellence and the development, in each student, of a positive self-image, love of learning, respect for others, and reverence for life. Our vision is the implementation of the curriculum frameworks and assessments of the International Baccalaureate Diploma Program in every classroom, to an ethnically, economically and intellectually diverse student body that reflects the diversity of New York CIty public schools. The Baccalaureate School for Global Education (BSGE) is an International Baccalaureate (IB), grades 7 -12, IB Diploma Program (DP) public school. The IB Diploma Program is an academically challenging and balanced program of education with cumulative assessments that prepare students, aged 16 to 19, for success at university and life beyond. It has been designed to address the intellectual, social, emotional and physical well being of students. The program has gained recognition and respect from the world’s leading universities. At BSGE, our Pre-IB Diploma Program covers grades 7-10 and is based on the principles and practices of the  IB Diploma Program.  The Pre-IB Diploma Program exposes students to a core curriculum that includes the following subjects: English, a foreign language (Mandarin and Spanish or Mandarin and French), humanities, science, math, visual arts, music, technology and  50-100 community and service hours.
